result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Cole Patterson #617733 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey Cole Patterson #617733 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey Cole Patterson #617733 was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to sign up for Probation by 4:00 p.m. June 27, 2014.
Probation to run concurrent.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Bond to apply.
DNA Sample and surcharge.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent with current sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: with any current sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
-Court costs previously paid.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Minot. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle. Atty Krave also appeared.   DF:  Jeffrey Cole Patterson appeared from jail. Includes 14CF67, 15CF435 and 15CM516. Case called at 1:04 pm. Court reviews files. ADA Minser makes statement. Court dismisses 15CM516. On 15CF435, Atty O'Boyle recites agreement. No objection from ADA Minser. Def pleads Guilty to Count one without repeater. Def sworn. Crt informs Def of rights. Crt finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds Def guilty of Count one without repeater enhancer. On motion of the State Crt dismisses Counts two and three. Parties make sentencing arguments. Def makes statement. Crt orders:

14CF67 -  2yrs i/c, 2 yrs e/s.  Concurrent to any current sentence
- Credit for 284 Days. 
- Def is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and CIP.  
- Costs to be paid through extended supervision

On 15CF435 - 2 yrs  probation w/h with conditions.  To run consecutive to all sentences
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and Regular Testing
- AODA and follow through
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- MRT
- Follow any other condition agent believe is necessary
- Court Costs
- Costs of Supervision
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
77 Days credit against ultimate sentence

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA: Amber Hahn   DF ATTY:  John M O'Boyle   DF:  Jeffrey Cole Patterson appeared from jail. Includes Plea on 14CF67, 14CF69, 13CF277, 13CF331, 13CM550, 12CT77 & PayH on 11CT327. Case called at 3:24 pm. Amended information was filed on 13CF277. Counts 4 and 5 are from Pierce and Polk County. Court reviews files. A PSI was not ordered. Court questions re: Drug Court Candidate. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 13CF277, 13CM550 and 14CF69, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count #1 in 13CF277, Count #1 13CM550 and Count #1 14CF67. All other charges are dismissed. Charges in Polk and Pierce County are read in and dismissed. Court orders COMPAS Assessment and then will do sentencing. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
